intro: Psilotrichum schimperi, commonly known as the African clubmoss, is a member of the family Lycopodiaceae and is native to parts of Africa. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a distinctive appearance with a short, erect stem and clusters of small, scale-like leaves. Its reproductive structures include sporangia that produce spores, which are dispersed by wind. Psilotrichum schimperi plays a role in its ecosystem by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
